entry.title: How Do We Solve the Challenges of glTF Asset Creation

media:group.media:title: How Do We Solve the Challenges of glTF Asset Creation
media:group.media:description:
Presentation: https://khr.io/zl
This webinar showcases the work currently taking place within the Khronos Group to address the challenges with leveraging glTF to create rich 3D visuals.
Agenda
00:01:18 - Asset Creation introduction - Eric Chadwick, Wayfair 00:03:55 - Building a Scalable Pipeline - Paweł Nikiel, CGTrader 00:16:13 - Conforming to Requirements - Max Limper, DGG 00:28:55 - Validating Assets - Mike Festa, Super DNA 3D Lab 00:36:20 - Open Discussion / Q&A with questions from the audience

entry.title: How to Use Synchronization Validation Across Multiple Queues and Command Buffers

media:group.media:title: How to Use Synchronization Validation Across Multiple Queues and Command Buffers
media:group.media:description:
Presentation: https://khr.io/zd
In this webinar we help developers understand and not be intimidated or confused by the latest Vulkan Synchronization enhancements, including support for multiple queues and command buffers. We introduce the Vulkan Synchronization API calls, and provide instructions and recommendations for using the validation tools, including how to understand the validation errors you are receiving and how to fix errors in your application.

media:group.media:title: WebGL + WebGPU Meetup - October 2022
media:group.media:description:
Presentations: https://khr.io/zc
October's WebGL™ + WebGPU meetup was a complete success. We thank our speakers and audience for an engaging event. Audience members were treated to updates from each group and a variety of exciting speakers showcasing their latest technology.
If you would like to be considered to present at one of our upcoming WebGL+ WebGPU Meetups, please reach out to events@khronos.org.
Agenda
00:01:01 - WebGL Updates 00:09:00 - WebGPU Updates 00:18:36 - Madcraft.io demonstration using the latest WebGL extensions 00:35:02 - Demonstration on use of WebGL in a scientific context for web molecular graphics in Mol* 01:03:09 - What's new in v2.0 and glTF 01:16:19 - Questions & Answers
Speakers: Ken Russel, Kelsey Gilbert, Ivan Popelyshev, Alexander Rose, Emmett Lalish

media:group.media:title: Delivering Interactive Experiences with glTF
media:group.media:description:
Just as we needed an industry standard format that would allow the efficient packaging and transmission of 3D assets (glTF), we now need new mechanisms that allow us to efficiently assemble and transmit an entire 3D scene from glTF assets, including ways to define behaviors and interactivity. In this webinar, members of the Khronos 3D Formats working group will preview and seek community feedback on proposals for how to add interactivity and behaviors to glTF. In addition, we preview what's on offer in the proposed interactivity behaviors extensions and showcase capabilities and preliminary implementations.
Speakers: Brent Scannell, Dwight Rodgers, Ben Houston Presentation: https://www.khronos.org/events/delivering-interactive-experiences-with-gltf

entry.title: Vulkan Japan Meetup - September 2022 (日本初 Vulkanミートアップ)

media:group.media:title: Vulkan Japan Meetup - September 2022 (日本初 Vulkanミートアップ)
media:group.media:description:
Presentations - https://khr.io/za
Khronos Vulkanised ウェビナーは、3D開発コミュニティに向けてKhronosのVulkanエキスパート達と一緒に最新の開発状況を把握し、エンジンやアプリケーション、タイトルでVulkanを最大限に活用するためのヒントやテクニックを学ぶ機会を提供するものです。日本で、且つ日本語で開催されるのは初めてですが、これを機に、2回目以降も続けられたら良いなと考えています。 The Khronos Vulkanised webinars provide the international 3D development community with the opportunity to join our Vulkan experts to gain insights into the latest developments and learn the tips and techniques to get the most out of Vulkan in their engine, application or title. This meetup was conducted in Japanese.
00:00:10 スタート 00:05:25 Introduction to Vulkan 00:41:30 学生/研究者からみたVulkan 00:58:54 Vulkanプログラミングガイド 01:03:49 Vulkan Developer Resources 01:13:13 Q&A フリーディスカッション
Presenters: Spencer Fricke, Yuki Nishidate, Marty Johnson, Takashi Umezawa

entry.title: Advanced PBR Material Parameters in glTF Webinar - September 2022

media:group.media:title: Advanced PBR Material Parameters in glTF Webinar - September 2022
media:group.media:description:
Presentation - https://khr.io/z9
Materials in glTF 2.0 use Physically Based Rendering (PBR) as a means of describing physical material properties to rendering engines. Recent extensions have added parameters such as Index of Refraction, Volumetric Absorption, and Iridescence, extending the range of physical materials that can be expressed. These PBR extensions bridge the gap between path tracing and real-time rasterization, enabling model compatibility across a range of engines from mobile to high-end rendering. In this webinar we take an in-depth look at the new PBR extensions, offer some insight into the design process, and compare path-traced outputs to real-time approximations.
Agenda
00:00:22 - Overview of the glTF PBR Material Model 00:26:50 - Real-time implementation of transmission 00:43:58 - Questions & Answers
Speakers: Ed Mackey (AGI), Alex Wood (AGI) Panelists: Tobias Häußler (Dassault Systèmes), Bastian Sdorra (Dassault Systèmes), Nicolas Savva (Autodesk), Emmett Lalish (Google), Adam Morris (Target), Eric Chadwick (Wayfair)
